meanings.definition: A handwritten or typed document, especially a literary or historical work.
meanings.sent1: The old manuscript was filled with beautiful handwriting.
meanings.sent2: She found an ancient manuscript in the library.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the manuscript, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed onto the pages of the manuscript like a river.
meanings.sent5: The manuscript held the secrets of a bygone era within its pages.

meanings.definition: The original copy of a book or article before it is printed.
meanings.sent1: The author carefully reviewed the manuscript before sending it to the publisher.
meanings.sent2: The manuscript was full of edits and corrections.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog chewed on the manuscript, delaying the printing process.
meanings.sent4: The manuscript was like a caterpillar waiting to transform into a published book.
meanings.sent5: The value of the manuscript lay in its potential to become a bestseller.
